entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Request For Tender - Updated Davisville Aquatic Community Centre Net Zero Building open to Pre-Qualified Suppliers from

textlist.text: This RFT is an invitation by the City for: The Supply of Labour, Material, Equipment and Supervision to complete the proposed new Davisville Community Aquatic Centre (New Zero Emissions Building, TGS v4, Tiers 2 & 3) located at 50 Davisville Avenue, Toronto, M4S 1E8 on behalf of the City of Toronto, Parks, Forestry and Recreation Division. The proposed new City facility is located on land owned by the TDSB (the landlord); the City is the tenant. The land has an occupied TDSB elementary school on site. The new City facility will be connected below grade to the existing school.
.1 To the following pre-qualified Suppliers only to submit bids for the performance of the Work, as further described in Part 3 (DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS) and the Contract:
(a) Aquicon Construction Co. Ltd.
(b) Atlas Constructors Inc
(c) Buttcon Limited
(d) Chandos
Public Posting: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17692203
Summary
N/A

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Request for Tenders for Sir Adam Beck AIR State of Good Repair

textlist.text: This RFT is an invitation by the City to submit bids for Sir Adam Beck Artificial Ice Rink state of good repair:
To the following pre-qualified Suppliers to submit bids for the performance of the Work, as further described in Part 3 (DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS) and the Contract:
1. Aquicon Construction Co. Ltd.
2. Duron Ontario Limited
3. Frank Pellegrino General Contracting Limited
4. Joe Pace & Sons Contracting Inc.
Only the Bids received from the Suppliers identified above shall be considered by the City.

**All relevant information and documents regarding this solicitation are posted as a Sourcing Event on the City of Toronto online procurement system SAP ARIBA: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17927789
Summary
Mandatory Site Meeting Info

Suppliers are required to attend a mandatory site meeting to familiarize themselves with the Project and ascertain the full extent of the Work required. The mandatory site meeting will take place at NOON local time on November 16, 2023, at Sir Adam Beck AIR, 55 Orianna Dr., Toronto. Site meetings will not be available at any other times.
Suppliers must sign the attendance sheet at the mandatory site meeting during the designated date and time for their Bid to be considered.
Bids submitted by Suppliers that do not attend the mandatory site meeting or fail to sign the attendance sheet shall be declared non compliant.

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Parallel Operation of Standby Natural Gas Generators and Gas Monitoring at the F.J. Horgan Water Treatment Plant

textlist.text: Summary
Mandatory Site Meeting:
.1 Suppliers are required to attend one (1) mandatory meeting to
familiarize themselves with the required Deliverables. The mandatory
meeting will take place as noted below. The site meeting will not be
available at any other time.
.2 F.J. Horgan Water Treatment Plant, 201 Copperfield Road,
Toronto, ON M1E 3T9, from 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM local Toronto
time on November 30, 2023. Attendees to meet at the Front
Entrance (South Parking Lot).
.3 Suppliers must advise the Procurement Contact via email at
least three (3) working days prior to the site meeting and
provide the name and contact information (telephone/email
address) of the personnel that will be attending.
.4 Suppliers must sign the attendance sheet at the mandatory
meeting during the designated date and time for their Bid to be
considered. Bids submitted by Suppliers that do not attend the
mandatory meeting or fail to sign the attendance sheet shall be
declared non-compliant.
.5 The Supplier Representatives must provide their own personal
protective equipment (PPE) prior to the meeting. Mandatory PPE
includes hard hat, high visibility vest and safety boots (minimum
CSA Green Patch).
.6 No statement or information provided in such meeting by either the
City or the Suppliers will amend any provision of this RFT or the
Contract, or may be relied upon by a Supplier in the RFT process
or its Bid, except and to the extent such statement or information
is later confirmed through the issuance of an Addendum.

To Register as a City of Toronto Supplier in SAP ARIBA: http://toronto.sourcing.ariba.com/ad/selfRegistration
Suppliers that have not received the registration or need further assistance in completing the registration, please contact the Supply Chain Helpdesk at supplychain@toronto.ca or 416-397-4141.

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Request for Supplier Qualifications for Heritage Architect Roster

textlist.text: The City of Toronto, Museums and Heritage Services through the Purchasing and Materials Management Division is inviting Responses from qualified Respondents for the purpose of establishing a Roster List of Heritage Architects to provide the City, on an “as required basis”, professional architectural heritage services for a period of one year from date of award, with an option to renew for two (2) additional one (1) year periods. The option to renew for the two (2) additional one (1) year periods will be based on the review of the Roster Vendor(s)’s performance level over the prior year and the availability of funds in the City’s capital budget for the renewal term. The City will be under no obligation to exercise any renewal option.
ARIBA LINK: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18104158
Summary

IMPORTANT NOTICE – Transition to City's new Source-to-pay tool – SAP Ariba

As of September, 2018, the City of Toronto will launch an online Source-to-Pay tool utilizing SAP Ariba and begin to migrate the City's Solicitations (RFQs, RFPs etc.) from being posted on the City's Online Call Document System to being posted through SAP Ariba. It is important for all Suppliers to register on the SAP Ariba network in order to continue to be able to access City of Toronto Solicitations. For more information on this transition please visit: Upcoming Changes to Bidding on City Contracts.
https://www.toronto.ca/business-economy/doing-business-with-the-city/understanding-the-procurement-process/
Any questions about this transition should be directed to City Bids at: supplychain@toronto.ca
Supplier Registration:
http://toronto.sourcing.ariba.com/ad/selfRegistration
Summary

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Parallel Operation of Standby Natural Gas Generators and Gas Monitoring at the F.J. Horgan Water Treatment Plant

textlist.text: Summary
Mandatory Site Meeting:
1. Suppliers are required to attend one (1) mandatory meeting to
familiarize themselves with the required Deliverables. The mandatory
meeting will take place as noted below. The site meeting will not be
available at any other time.
2. F.J. Horgan Water Treatment Plant, 201 Copperfield Road,
Toronto, ON M1E 3T9, from 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM local Toronto
time on November 30, 2023. Attendees to meet at the Front
Entrance (South Parking Lot).
3. Suppliers must advise the Procurement Contact via email at
least three (3) working days prior to the site meeting and
provide the name and contact information (telephone/email
address) of the personnel that will be attending.
4. Suppliers must sign the attendance sheet at the mandatory
meeting during the designated date and time for their Bid to be
considered. Bids submitted by Suppliers that do not attend the
mandatory meeting or fail to sign the attendance sheet shall be
declared non-compliant.
5. The Supplier Representatives must provide their own personal
protective equipment (PPE) prior to the meeting. Mandatory PPE
includes hard hat, high visibility vest and safety boots (minimum
CSA Green Patch).
6. No statement or information provided in such meeting by either the
City or the Suppliers will amend any provision of this RFT or the
Contract, or may be relied upon by a Supplier in the RFT process
or its Bid, except and to the extent such statement or information
is later confirmed through the issuance of an Addendum.

entrydata.name: Description
entrydata.text: Indigenous-led Operator for the Indigenous Centre for Innovation and Entrepreneurship, located in a City-owned section of a condominium building at 200 Dundas Street East for the City of Toronto's Economic Development and Culture Division, as further described in Part 3

textlist.text: Summary
Mandatory Information Meeting

Suppliers are required to attend a meeting via WebEx to ask clarifying questions and familiarize themselves with the required Deliverables. The meeting will be virtually hosted on September 20, 2023. Meetings will not be available at any other times.
Mandatory Site Visit

Suppliers are required to attend one of two site visits to familiarize themselves with the ICIE space and required Deliverables. The mandatory ICIE site visit dates will take place at 11:00 AM local time on September 27 and October 4, 2023 at 200 Dundas St. E, Toronto. Site visits will not be available at any other times.

entrydata.text: []Notice of Intended Procurement Doc3313684000.pdf[ ] (224 Kbytes) 08/22/2023

entrydata.name: ShortDescription
entrydata.text: Electrical Exterior Lighting Upgrade and Upgrades for Mobile Generators Connection for Multiple Transfer Stations & Yard

textlist.text: Provision of Electrical Exterior Lighting Upgrade and Mobile Generators Connections for Multiple Transfer Stations & Yards for the City of Toronto's Solid Waste Management Service Division (SWMS).

The Supplier shall provide engineering services for the sites investigation, technical review, pre-design, detailed design, tendering and construction of recommended replacements of facilities components inclusive of specifications and contract drawings as outlined in the RFP.
Summary
Mandatory Meeting:

1.Suppliers are required to attend BOTH mandatory meetings to familiarize themselves with the required Deliverables. The mandatory meetings will take place at 10:00 am local time on October 31, 2023 at 120 Disco Rd., Toronto, Disco Road Transfer Station, and at 9:00 am local time on November 02, 2023 at Lot 20-22, Concession Rd. 3, Pickering City, ON, Brock West Landfill(Revised per A1).
Meetings will not be available at any other times.
2.Suppliers must sign the attendance sheet at the mandatory meetings during the designated dates and times for their Bid to be considered.
3.Bids submitted by Suppliers that do not attend the mandatory meetings or fail to sign the attendance sheets shall be declared non-compliant.
4.Protective headwear (hard hat), reflective vest, safety goggles, and safety boots are mandatory for the site visits.
